findings.title: Unprotected initializer
findings.description: The initializer functions __ERC20_init, __Ownable_init, and __Context_init are unprotected and can be called multiple times, potentially leading to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unsecured transfer
findings.description: A non-whitelisted wallet can transfer a specified number of tokens without any restrictions.

findings.title: Unsecured transferFrom
findings.description: The smart contract allows unsecured transfer of tokens from one wallet to another without proper validation or access control.

findings.title: Unsecured increaseAllowance
findings.description: The increaseAllowance function lacks proper security measures, potentially leading to unauthorized allowance increases.

findings.title: Unsecured decreaseAllowance
findings.description: The decreaseAllowance function does not properly secure the allowance decrease operation.

findings.title: Unprotected minting
findings.description: The _mint function is internal and does not have any access modifiers, allowing anyone to mint new tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected burning
findings.description: The _burn function does not have any access control, allowing anyone to burn tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected token transfer
findings.description: A non-whitelisted wallet can transfer a specified number of tokens without any restrictions.

findings.title: Unprotected ownership renouncement
findings.description: The active smart contract owner has elevated privileges which can impact the safety and security of the smart contract.

findings.title: Unprotected ownership transfer
findings.description: The active smart contract owner has elevated privileges to change transaction fees and execute transfer of contract ownership to a specified wallet or dead address.

findings.title: Unsecured withdrawal of dividends
findings.description: The withdrawDividend() function allows unsecured withdrawal of dividends.

findings.title: Unsecured exclusion from dividends
findings.description: The 'isExcludedFromDividends' function does not have any access control, allowing anyone to exclude users from receiving dividends.

findings.title: Unsecured update of claim wait
findings.description: The 'claimWait' can be updated without proper access control, allowing unauthorized users to manipulate it.

findings.title: Unsecured update of minimum token balance for dividends
findings.description: The function updateMinimumTokenBalanceForDividends is accessible by the owner only and can be updated without any security checks, potentially leading to unauthorized changes to the dividend distribution mechanism.

findings.title: Unsecured processing of accounts
findings.description: The processAccount function allows unsecured processing of accounts without proper access control, potentially leading to unauthorized account modifications.
